titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the C. William Britcher Thesis MC.283
titlestmt.author: Rachel Searcy

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:40:23 -0400.

did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact university-archives@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
did.abstract: C. William Britcher was a student at New York University's School of Public Administration in the early 1950s. This collection consists of a single item, Britcher's 1952 thesis for his Master of Public Administration titled "Quality Control of Small Lots."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single item, C. William Britcher's 1952 thesis for his Master of Public Administration at New York University titled "Quality Control of Small Lots."

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: C. William Britcher was a student at New York University's School of Public Administration in the early 1950s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item, and has not been arranged by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for materials in this collection, created by C. William Britcher, was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Mary Britcher, C. William Britcher's widow, in September 2017; the accession number associated with this gift is 2017.053.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; C. William Britcher Thesis; MC 283; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: At the time of accessioning, materials in this collection were rehoused in an archival box and folder, and described on the collection-level.
